author: dlr
msg: When ServerSocket's constructor is passed a null InetAddress, it binds
to INADDR_ANY (e.g. all network interfaces on a multi-homed host).
This is more in line with what other popular servers do (e.g. Apache
httpd), and since we have the "paranoia" setting, is safe enough.

author: dlr
msg: Updated test case for recent changes to the WebServer class.

author: dlr
msg: A better implementation of CVS rev 1.19 for history's sake.

author: dlr
msg: If an address to bind our listener socket to is not specified, try
harder to bind to the loopback interface rather than to a random
network interface at the beginning of the setupServerSocket(int)
